Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness by failing to interview all applicants and dependents
Application_Facts: Second applicant was likely present but not interviewed; officer rejected plausible evidence without considering illiteracy; persecution claims under Convention refugee class were not explored
Decision_Outcome: Application allowed, decisions set aside, cases remitted for reconsideration
Court_Ruling: Procedural fairness breach found; cases sent for reconsideration
Defendant_Behavior: Officer failed to interview all applicants, dismissed evidence without proper consideration, did not explore refugee claims
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged lack of credibility in permanent resident applications
Assessment_Factor: Credibility, illiteracy, presence of dependents, refugee claim validity
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide opportunity to respond to concerns, lack of interview
Credibility_Assessment: Officer rejected plausible evidence without adequate justification
Evidence_Used: Applicant statements, supporting documents, evidence of presence
Legal_Provision_Cited: Procedural fairness obligations under administrative law
Application_Basis: Permanent resident application under refugee class
Evidence_Assessed: Evidence of presence, illiteracy, persecution claims
Relief_Sought: Allowance of application, setting aside of refusal, remittal for reconsideration
Governing_Rule: Procedural fairness requires opportunity to respond unless legislatively exempted
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider illiteracy as factor in document submission or interview
Outcome: Application allowed, decision set aside, remitted
Harm_Assessment: Potential denial of rightful permanent residency due to unfair process
Cause_Description: Refusal of permanent resident applications due to alleged lack of credibility
Evidence_Handling: Rejection of plausible evidence without sufficient reasoning
Legal_Provision_Violated: Implied breach of procedural fairness under IRPA and common law
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient consideration of contextual factors such as illiteracy
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, principles of procedural fairness
Evidence_Assessment: Inadequate evaluation of credibility and supporting evidence
Decision_Rationale: Officer did not fulfill duty of fairness in assessment process
Decision_Making_Body: Visa Office, Federal Court on judicial review
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of interview, dismissal of evidence without context
